channel.title: Because i seem to fuck over every memory drive i have
channel.description:
Okay since i literally fuck up every memory drive i own, awhile ago i tried to install Ubuntu onto my Maxter oneTouch 4 500GB external drive, it horribly failed and i had to reformat the entire drive, after i did that i just put the drive into my closet avoiding the problem because i knew i really fucked it up. But now i need it for extra memory, and it no longer has an NTFS portion, the drive doesn't even show up as an external Drive (ex, drive F) in "my computer" but it shows its connected in the maxter manager program but the drive shows up as "UNKOWN" and has absolutely no information about the drive. i really need help plzzzz ): . i also emailed the support center at Maxtor website, they are no help at all since it has been over 5 days and have gotten no reply.
[b][b]DRIVE INFOOOOOO (:[/b][/b]
I Have this [url=http://www.seagate.com/ww/v/index.jsp?vgnextoid=ec6a961949af7110VgnVCM100000f5ee0a0aRCRD&locale=en-US]CLICK TEH LINK :D[/url]
[img]http://images.macnn.com/macnn/news/0709/maxtor-one-touch-basic.jpg[/img]

item.title: Because i seem to fuck over every memory drive i have
item.dc:creator: @thefalloffuckingtroy thefalloffuckingtroy.
item.description:
@thefalloffuckingtroy wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:7, topic:248075”]You need to use the Drive Manager tool, it wont show up in My Computer unless its formatted.

If you use XP: Control Panel->Administrative Tools->Disk Management

Right click, format[/quote]
thanks a lot dude. i just deleted the old partions and made new ones, all thanks to you you big sexy man come give me a hug

Read full topic

You need to use the Drive Manager tool, it wont show up in My Computer unless its formatted.

If you use XP: Control Panel->Administrative Tools->Disk Management

Right click, format
